required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Randomized Phase 3 Trial of Pemetrexed and Cisplatin Versus Gemcitabine and Cisplatin in Patients With Locally Advanced or Metastatic Non Small Cell Lung Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized Phase 3 Trial of ALIMTA and Cisplatin Versus GEMZAR and Cisplatin in Patients With Locally Advanced or Metastatic Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: This study is a randomized Phase 3 study comparing pemetrexed and cisplatin combination to gemcitabine and cisplatin for the treatment of Non Small Cell Lung Cancer (NCSLC). Gemcitabine plus cisplatin is currently the standard of care for NSCLC. It is thought that pemetrexed plus cisplatin may be as effective and may have fewer side effects than the standard of care.

primary_outcome.time_frame: baseline to date of death from any cause

secondary_outcome.time_frame: time of response to progressive disease

intervention.description: 500 mg/m2, IV q 21 days x 6 cycles
1250 mg/m2, IV, day 1 and 8 q 21 days x 6 cycles
75 mg/m2, IV, q 21 days x 6 cycles

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of NSCLC Stage IIIB not amenable to curative treatment or Stage IV.
- No prior chemotherapy for lung cancer.
- Patients must have at least one uni-dimensionally measurable lesion.
- Prior radiation therapy to less than 25% of bone marrow, whole pelvis not allowed. Radiation must be completed at least 4 weeks prior to study enrollment.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Treatment with any drug within the last 30 days that has not received regulatory approval.
- Serious cardiac condition.
- Serious medical disorder in addition to NSCLC that would make it difficult for the patient to complete the study.
- Inability or unwillingness to take folic acid or Vitamin B12 supplementation.
- Presence of fluid retention that cannot be controlled by drainage.

patient_data.ipd_description: Lilly provides access to the individual patient data from studies on approved medicines and indications as defined by the sponsor specific information on ClinicalStudyDataRequest.com. This access is provided in a timely fashion after the primary publication is accepted. Researchers need to have an approved research proposal submitted through ClinicalStudyDataRequest.com. Access to the data will be provided in a secure data sharing environment after signing a data sharing agreement.
